metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20149 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In WordPress before 4.9.9 and 5.x before 5.0.1, when the Apache HTTP Server is used, authors could upload crafted files that bypass intended MIME type restrictions, leading to XSS, as demonstrated by a .jpg file without JPEG data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-20149` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 5.0.1+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 5.0.1+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 5.0.1+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 5.0.1+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 5.0.1+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.1+dfsg1-1').
